byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer and Oleg Matsnev contributed reporting.
byline.original: By JUSTIN GILLIS and HENRY FOUNTAIN

abstract: Scientists' warnings that climate change poses significant threat to immense tracts of boreal forest ringing Northern Hemisphere appear to be coming true with uptick in forest fires; trend is exemplified by loss of forest in Alberta, Canada, after wildfire; researchers say large-scale destruction of forests could seriously affect efforts to limit, and could even speed up, global warming.
lead_paragraph: Scientists say the near-destruction of Fort McMurray last week by a wildfire is the latest indication that the vital boreal forest is at risk from climate change.

headline.main: Global Warming Cited as Wildfires Increase in Fragile Boreal Forest
headline.print_headline: Warming Seen as Lit Match in Northern Forests
